eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Yale Danceworks
eventData.description:
Danceworks is the 2nd oldest and only non-audition dance group at Yale. In non-COVID times, each of our 200+ members commit to any number of semester-long dances that each rehearse for an hour per week. At the end of each semester, we put on a sell-out semester show featuring all ~16 dances and a handful of shorter interludes that company members can propose. Our genres range from jazz to hip-hop, from Broadway to open-style, and we're all about sharing the fun of dancing with anyone who wants to participate. Our members come in with years of experience, or none! Finally, we also host regular social events and study breaks to keep the community engaged!

We are welcoming back a Danceworks alum for  a fun and accessible dance workshop, which will include a short Q&A with current Danceworks members. All you will need is your Zoom app, and we strongly encourage anyone who is curious about dance. Follow us on Instagram and Facebook for more information about the song choice, choreographer, and exclusive videos!

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Distilled Periodical
eventData.description:
Distilled Periodical is a student-run annual publication focused on analysis of pressing real-world issues from a variety of perspectives, ranging from the sciences (social, natural, and physical) to the humanities. Our extended editorial process allows writers to work closely with a small group of editors to distill complex problems and articulate ideas drawing from diverse areas of knowledge. We welcome students of all academic interests and experience levels.

Are you passionate about topics that don't fit neatly into a single discipline? Are you interested in writing or editing but intimidated by the process? Do you like art? Come learn more about Distilled, our extended editorial process, and how to promote change through writing!

As a plus, join to participate in a raffle

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Yale Ballroom Dance Team and Club
eventData.description:
Yale Ballroom Dance Team and Club focuses on providing an encouraging and accepting environment for everyone. We organize practices and lessons, taught by veteran team members and professional instructors, catered to all skill levels from newcomers to champions. Everyone is welcomed and no prior dance experience is required! Members have the opportunity to participate in competitions and showcases each semester.

Spend a night with Yale Ballroom Dancers, where we will screen highlights from our past performances with live commentary and be available to answer all your questions about our team!

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Yale Mixed Martial Arts Club
eventData.description:
We are the Yale Mixed Martial Arts Club. Formed by combining the former Muay Thai Kickboxing Club and Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu Club, we focus on all aspects of the fighting arts; stand-up striking, ground fighting, submissions, etc. We welcome people of all experience levels and fighting backgrounds (if any), and want to create a community where people can share and learn about martial arts from each other. All equipment provided, sparring is optional. Only requirement is that you come prepared to work out a sweat!

Q&A session about the club, martial arts in general, or just about life. We'd love to get to know you all not just as fighters, but as members of the club family!

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Broad Recognition
eventData.description:
Broad Recognition (www.broadsatyale.com) is an intersectional feminist student magazine at Yale. We are a radically progressive collective of friends, writers, and thinkers dedicated to understanding the way power impacts our communities. We seek to use our writing as a platform for understanding the world around us with the hopes of ultimately overturning the status quo. We dream of a world centered around communities of love instead of economies of capital.

This will be an open space to learn about Broad Recognition and our work. Meet current Broads writers and learn how to get more involved!

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Yale Debate Association
eventData.description:
As Yale's only competitive intercollegiate debating organization, we compete in the American Parliamentary style of debate as a member of the American Parliamentary Debate Association (APDA) and in the British Parliamentary style as a member of the US Universities Debating Association (USUDA). We travel to represent Yale both across the country and around the world, and we are the top team in North America.

Members of the YDA will host a demonstration debate on a fun and interesting topic -- no debate experience required! We will talk a bit about the team before opening up for questions about the YDA and Yale. We would love for you to attend -- if you are unable to make it, check out our Facebook at www.facebook.com/yaledebateassociation for more information about the team. You can also learn more on our website at yaledebate.org and contact any Board member with questions.

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Women and Gender Minorities in Comp Sci
eventData.description:
We are a group dedicated to creating a supportive community on campus for women and gender minorities interested in computer science. We include everyone from life long coders to non-majors looking to learn coding! Each year, we host a variety of events including social events to build our community, professional events to help prepare our members for future opportunities like jobs and internships, and events to aid our members with their academics.

Come learn about Yale Women and Gender Minorities in Computer Science! Ask questions about WGiCS, being a women in CS, or CS at Yale in general and play some games/brain teasers.

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Guild of Bookmakers
eventData.description:
The purpose of the Guild of Bookmakers is to make the experience of bookbinding available to everyone on campus, to rekindle interest in bookbinding and the book arts, and to bring together people who share a love of bookbinding.

Want to learn how to make a book? Join the Guild of Bookmakers to learn the process of making a softcover book! If you are able, feel free to bring scrapbooking paper, printer paper, a needle, and thread to make your very own softcover book (takes about 30 minutes)! Otherwise, feel free to simply stop by and chat! We'd love to get to know you!
